rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
'eliminate' is not a high-potency verb describing the virus impact.
Describes confidence/strategy ('will be able to eliminate').
Segment does not contain a question.
The segment quotes a source stating confidence in future elimination ('will be able to eliminate'), not current safety/control.
The segment states 'All the signs that we have are...we will be able to eliminate this', which is Q5 Explicit Calming, not Q6.
The segment contains 'will be able to eliminate' which is a statement of capability/confidence, not a bare negation.
States 'with good biosecurity, with good farmer participation, we will be able to eliminate this', describing safeguards/measures and a hopeful future possibility without active reassurance.
